data.title: Celebrity watch! Drew Barrymore heads to Kentucky for her next film
data.text:
The romantic comedy "The Stand-In," produced by and starring Drew Barrymore, has begun shooting in New York City and will soon continue production at the Wrigley Media Group Studios in Lexington.

Emmy-nominated TV director Jamie Babbit directs Barrymore in a dual lead role as Candy, a disillusioned comedy actress, and Paula, her ambitious and unemployed stand-in.

According to a news release, Candy (Barrymore), a washed-up movie star with mounting legal problems, hires her unemployed and adoring stand-in Paula to go to rehab in her place. Upon release, a weird co-dependent relationship ensues as Candy begins to use Paula as a stand-in in all parts of her life to escape from the stressful demands of fame.

Eventually, Paula starts to take over Candy's identity, career and boyfriend, finally kicking Candy out of her own house.

You may like: Louisville's Vince Tyra trades Cards for the theater â€” for 1 night only

Candy is forced to survive in the real world for the first time while Paula lives the celebrity life of her dreams … until her boyfriend discovers the truth about the woman he's sleeping with.

Babbit is a director known for her work on "The Gilmore Girls," "Girlboss," "Brooklyn Nine-Nine," "Silicon Valley," "Girls," "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" and more.

Although no release date has been announced for "The Stand-In," keep an eye out for Barrymore around Lexington in the coming weeks.
